Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Arul N
Reviews.Content: The room was a good sized one and bathroom was very clean.Nearby to a very nice shopping mall with good restaurants in the basement and a supermarket. I would suggest to use the Maria Cristina station in L3 line as it seems closer to the hotel.Easier access to the city centre.Also there were few restaurants outside on the back side of hotel which were good and less expensive whereas the hotel restaurant is pricey.Room views are not good as there are buildings on all sides.Hotel atmosphere is very bland and mediocre.However the front desk staff were very helpful. Overall a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel, too bad about troublesome wifi”
Reviews.Author: LWSALB
Reviews.Content: Huge lines at check-in need to be better managed and NH needs to switch to free wifi, or bill to room wifi, rather than having guests upload credit card details every 24 hours to Swisscom. I don't like the modern cement walled hallways or the fashionabky slanted windows, but for cleanliness, service, etc it ticked all the boxes. excellent breakfast buffet. Though the location is inconvenient for getting to the center, the stores and cafes out back allow you to leave the hotel, without having to stray too far. The plaza de Concordia is only 3 blocks and gives that old town feeling that you want.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: MFYon
Reviews.Content: The bathroom had hair all over the floor when we checked in. I took a photo of it and will try to upload it. The room was stuffy and the air conditioning wasn't working. Couldn't open the windows and complained to the front desk. They sent someone who opened the window. We were facing the front street so it was very noisy that bite with the window open. The front office wasn't very friendly or helpful. Rather abrupt.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done.”
Reviews.Author: SL D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, well staffed and has all the modern conveniences. The front desk staff is not exactly welcoming, but efficient. The domestic staff and restaurant staff are friendly and helpful. If you like to shop, you couldn't be in a better place. A HUGE mall is across the square and a BIG Cortes Ingles is down the street. WiFi is available in room but a bit pricey, free WiFi in the lobby. The pool area is tiny, the restaurants good.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: cesartapia
Reviews.Content: A friend living in Barcelona recommended us this hotel.... At first I was not thrill by the location nor the features on the web page but since we arrived the reality was that it has a great location, just behind the biggest shopping mall in Barcelona, l'ille, and onto Diagonal avenue, a comercial area full of places to eat and mix with locals. We walked around and also found out that NOU Stadium was minutes away and even bought tickets to Osasua-FC Barca game. Ramblas is just 6 euros away in taxi drive.... Great and modern hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a converted car park”
Reviews.Author: MyBoyBlu
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business, with meetings 5 minutes walk away. This hotel is basically ok: clean, decent sized rooms, polite staff. But the decor is dark and minimalist, which I found cold and unwelcoming. A few other things annoyed me. Cars are unable to pull up to the entrance, which meant i had to struggle with all my bags for around 50 yards (no help from staff either). The bed was on rollers and kept moving when I sat up against the wall. Room service menu didn't have much choice (although quality was decent). Breakfast was very average with limited choice - particularly for hot food.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCat
Reviews.Content: Check in took absolutely ages. Rooms cold but clean

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nico003
Reviews.Content: New hotel, modern decoration, very good rooms and bathrooms. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “All show and no go”
Reviews.Author: patrick f
Reviews.Content: I had much higher expectations. Yes it was clean, stylish and modern but front desk service was poor. Location was good for business and ok or not so great for site-seeing. Breakfast and wifi not included and both expensive. The house keeping were incredibly hit and miss with what they'd do. Maybe new soap, maybe not! Never replenished mini bar or coffee facilities. The heat/ac either didn't work or had a complete mind of it's own and you couldn't open the window! But all this pales when the Sat night a club was operating in the shopping center next door and the patrons going in and out were sooooo noisy I couldn't sleep until almost 4am!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: Men-rui
Reviews.Content: We had a deal voucher for this hotel comprising 2 nights stay with dinner and access to the spa. I loved the loaction of the hotel as it is right next to the big shopping centre so plenty of shops close by, there is also some nice restaurants and cafes close by the hotel which are great to relax in during the day or on the way back to the hotel in the evening as they are quieter and more relaxing than in the city centre. The best thing about the hotel was our room, we had a superior room which was really spacious and had lots of luxury comforts. The bathroom was huge with a great shower and bath and lots of nice toiletries. The room was always kept clean and was really modern. We only used the Spa once, we had free entry with the deal but I think normal entry price is in the region of €15 which I think is a bit much to expect guests to pay to simply use the steam room and sauna. I did however get a manicure and pedicure when there and the girl who did them was fantastic, spent lots more time than required with me and was extremely friendly and tried making conversation despite the language barrier. It was a very enjoyable experience and decent value too. We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening. We went down quite late and the restaurant was pretty much empty and lacked any character. The meal was ok but much better quality to be found outside the hotel. If I didnt have the voucher I would not have been very happy paying for the food given the quality and lack of ambience. The hotel bar is also kind of quiet and lacks any atmosphere. The staff in the hotel could be a little bit better in the area of customer service. The front reception is painfully slow and they seem a litte uninterested, same can be said for staff in the restaurant and bar. All in all the hotel has good facilities, is clean and spacious and offered us exactly what we wanted for the beginning of our trip. It does however lack any real character and customer service could be a little better. I did however love the way we got fresh coo water delivered every morning. This was a nice little touch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern and great location.”
Reviews.Author: ThierryHubert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 5 times over the last 3 year. The loby WiFi access makes it easy to stay connected and the location is great with both brand stores, markets and local restaurants. Great when in business. The roof pool is small but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fall in love with this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: 69ozzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a business trip as it was booked by my colleagues for convenience. seriously the only beauty of this hotel was the walking distance to the office..... The check in was problematic, the lady was puzzled not to see a EU passport, did not know what to do with it...The non-welcoming arrogance hurts! The building it itself is odd, you get the feeling they converted a multi story parking block into a hotel. The rooms try to be of modern design, but the minimalism has the effect that you hardly have any furniture in the room. The parquet is cheap and was dusty. The sheets and towels were very clean and the minibar prices were reasonable. Unfortunately free wifi is not available in your room, you either pay, or have to sit in the lobby. The vouchers are valid only 30 minutes, and it is problematic to log on. The speed is very low. The breakfast was sort of ok, if you like to have eggs, you need to order them. The day we arrived there seemed to be a large group, so the breakfast hall was overcrowded, the only chance to get a coffee was standing in row in front of the coffee machines for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcg1979
Reviews.Content: Clean and well equipped with everything you would expect from a business hotel. Strong and easily accessible wifi with good working space in rooms. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. A very good business hotel, although it caters very heavily towards business so wouldn't recommend it for personal stay

Reviews.Title: “"Classy, modernistic .. Good value for money"”
Reviews.Author: EasyBizTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in barcelona for a weekend ... company booked me at NH Constanza.. i had heard of the chain but never used the services.. the negihbourhood was a bit residential but the hitel building was big, clean.. very sleek, arty yet minimalist design in the rooms.. very good attention to details in the room .. sumptuous breakfast ... friendly staff.. ... would definitely recommend to any business traveller in barcelona"

Reviews.Title: “problem with check-in for groups”
Reviews.Author: malufra
Reviews.Content: Not very flexible when it comes to organising check-in for groups of over 80 persons. Frontdesk management insists on photocopying all passports and filling in forms so that it can take up to one and half hours to check-in even though management already possess credit card details of all clients from the travel agency. Not a very professional approach to business. So group organisers beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have found a better hotel for the price !!!”
Reviews.Author: sjainuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the tram station and pick-up points for the Citysightseeing hop-on hop-off bus pickup points and shopping center. The interior of the hotel is very modern but lacks any character. The rooms are luxurious but bland.. The staff is very rude and non-hospitable. The manager is not in the hotel most of the time, the assistant manager didnt find it worth meeting us despite we having a issues with their service - reported on 3 different occasions. We had asked for a double bed room, but were offered only a twin-bed. I did the booking through expedia, and the staff bluntly told us that we didnt get the request for a double bed. Its a problem with your request / expedia's IT systems, so we cant do anything about it. This was despite me showing that a double bed room was requested and even the printout of the booking made showed it. We were locked out of our room on the second day and had to go to get the keys activated again. Overall a forgettable experience.. Wouldnt recommend to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: efesmurat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and convenient location,unusually friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; would recommend for business or vacation”
Reviews.Author: kdgr
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel with clean rooms and excellent breakfast. Also, centrally located. The staff was a bit overworked and busy, and therefore weren't all that helpful but I don't think it was necessarily their fault. Also, the fitness room opened at 10am which was a bit late for me, so I couldn't check it out. However, my room with 2 single beds was very spacious, also with a huge bathroom and they met my request for a room that opened on a side-street rather than a busier street. The breakfast was pretty amazing, and included basically everything. Would stay there again, but would recommend trying to book in advance to get a good/better price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! You decide whether It's really a four Star”
Reviews.Author: Daleyjackson
Reviews.Content: Hotel or not!!! upon Arrival at the hotel welcoming was okay, Wasn't asked whether we prefer Smoking or non smoking room we where given a twin room to my dismay as I had previously contacted the hotel and told them it was a celebratory Anniversary weekend. booked a superior room no tea coffee facilities waited 1hr for a kettle or told there would be a charge for Hot water!!. No Iron available £9.00 or 8.90 euros same price to iron trousers OUTRAGEOUS. Late check out 10 euro's for every hour. Car parking 19 euro.s per day Breakfast really disappointing asked for scrambled eggs got not sure cross between scrambled and omelette with peppers onions etc. I bought along some balloons and other small decorations with me asked if the hotel could sort them out for me whilst we where away from our room. Staff not so helpful depends if we are busy was the answer!!!!! So that did not happen. Beds comfortable but noisy just even to move around on noisy enough to distrub sleep. We went to the spa for 1 hour then lady came and said we closed now. and that was that!!! All of this probably sounds negative but it was okay I look at attention to detail and believe it a hotel or any service industry establishment takes care of the small things that bigger things will fall into place. We stay in 5* hotels around the world and there is a huge difference in service and expectations. location of hotel was nice shopping mall just out side park and sitting area coffee shops bars all very local. lots to see and do everything now in europe with the euro is so very expensive no value dont shop here its cheaper in the UK. Marc in reception was sweet Its just a pitty I did meet with him when we where checking in..

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning so open the window”
Reviews.Author: ISPpilot
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a warm room. Turned on the AC and after an hour, it did not feel like the room was getting cooler. Called down to the front desk and their response was that since it was not summer yet, the AC has not been turned on so open the window. The choice was stay uncomfortably warm or be disturbed by the noise outside. Bed was adequate, bathroom clean and breakfast buffet was plentiful. No free internet but you can ask the front desk for a voucher for wifi or to use the computer in the business center. It is not in the most central location but it is in a relatively safe neighborhood. Aside from the climate issue, the hotel is OK but it's a big enough issue that I would consider staying somewhere else on future visits to Barcelona, especially in the spring when the temperature during the day reaches the mid 70s.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: philc70
Reviews.Content: Probably not a bad place to stay for a weekend away in Barcelona if you are also happy to fly in on Easyjet. It is certainly minimalist, in a basic sort of way, although not uncomfortable. But it lacks the basic facilities for a business hotel. I have come off a flight with my clothes for tomorrow's meeting in a suitcase and the hotel cannot even provide an iron. A laundry service that can iron clothes in 24 hours time simply does not cut it for business travel. These basics are easy and cheap to get right and there is no excuse for not doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a nice urban area”
Reviews.Author: ilsetje
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on my third trip to Barcelona. I decided that this time I didn't want to stay in the overcrowded city centre. Rhis hotel was great, comfortable, trendy, nice breakfast, good spa en for a much lower price then you pay in the city centre. It's a 15 minute walk to the subway, so that's probably the only downside. It has a big shopping mall with some bars/restaurant just a few steps outside. Overall, if you want to go to Barcelona and don't want to spend all day in the tourist area this is a perfect hotel. Ow and the beds are amazing and soooo big!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay - and you have to like the minimalist design”
Reviews.Author: Hela1
Reviews.Content: The design of this hotel is very minimalist , and you have to really like it in order to enjoy this hotel. There is lots and lots of bare concrete, the rooms are decorated in dark grey color- I felt a bit claustrophobic when I walked in. Overall the hotel needs a bit of updating. On the positive side - the room was very clean and the bathroom was very spacious. The staff at reception spoke good English. Breakfast was ok, with the normal foods offered in other 4-star Spanish hotels. I felt the service was really slow - it took quite a long time to get the waiters' attention. It was fine for one night while travelling on business but I would not chose this hotel if I was travelling as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, minimalistic bargain”
Reviews.Author: lgts
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this place during our 5 day trip to Barcelona. The hotel, a large, modern building, is located a bit away from the city centre (although the subway is not so far), next to the L' Illa shopping mall and a small park. The staff, during check in (at about 2.00 AM) was helpful and spoke great english. Our room, a standard one, was well sized, with minimalistic furniture and decorated in grey shades. The only drawback was the fact that the king size bed was actually 2 single beds pushed together. The large bathroom had the same minimalistic design with the room. What is more, it offered both a bathtub and a shower, something rare for a 4 stars hotel. Breakfast buffet was rich both in quantity and quality. Something worth mentioning was the fact that omelletes were not premade, but were prepared only when asking for. The Nhube restaurant, from the other side, was overpriced and the food quantity was really small. Talking about the taste, it didn't make any sense, at least to us. We had much better meals at restaurants in the city. The rooftop pool, although very small, was nice and relaxing. The lack of a rooftop bar, although some could see as a drawback, in my opinion was a plus, as the area was quiet, every time we visited it. There are also spa facilities in the hotel, which we didn't try. In general, the NH Constanza is a nice, relaxing hotel to stay, especially for those who like modern design. Considering the price we did pay, it could be regarded as a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars rating for this exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip in the fabulous Barcelona and this hotel added to the overall fantastic experience. Everything was great, from the prompt smiley check-in in excellent english (a special thanks to Pierpaolo) to room facilities and ambience. Full size bathtub, seperate shower, plenty of room amenities, mini-bar, TFT TV, PLUS free access to roof-top swimming pool, fitness center and a great Spa that includes a finnish sauna, turkish steam bath and big jacuzzi with all sorts of hydro-jets. Very relaxing experience as a mid-day or afternoon break to help you going on enjoying Barcelona. Breakfast was also magnificent including huge varieties going beyond typical since you could even prepare your own tapas and requst hot dishes, omelletes and cappuccino promptly served at your table upon request. For a 69EUR early booking rate, the overall value for money was simply unsurpassed. Location is also great, opposite L'Illa shopping center which is huge. The tour-guide narration in the hop-on/off buses disctribed it as horizontal skyscrapper. I suggest to select Barcelona city tours and not Barcelon Bus Touristic since the latter don't have a stop at the shopping center. If you plan to use the metro, I suggest to use the Maria Cristina station and not Les Corts which is written in hotel's webpage. It will take you 10 mins on-foot and then the green L3 line will get you directly to the town center (Plaza Catalunya / Passeig de Gracia)

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel, with minimalist decoration all in shades of grey, white and silver. Its big. The rooms are big and comfortable, very clean with lots of drawers and big closets. The bathroom is roomy, nicely decorated. People at front desk very friendly. There's a good but little expensive japanese restaurant next door. There's also a mall next to the hotel. With fine stores and many options to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: audrealamb
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and staff was friendly and spoke English well!!! Location was great...connected to a large shopping mall and right on the main strip. Tour bus routes were within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, great price, excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: latitude180
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. Having stayed in hundreds of hotels globally this is a perfect find at an exceptional price. I stayed at a 5 star hotel in Barcelona a few days before moving to the Constanza, the look and feel of the rooms were exactly the same except the Constanza is slightly smaller. Great modern / contemporary design, 5 mins walk to Catalunya Sq, free internet and breakfast and super friendly staff, always willing to give advice and direction.... A real Gem!!! Upon checking out of this hotel I complimented the staff and thanked them and as I did so others checking out joined in chorus. You will not be disappointed here. Only drawback is that the rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Not what 4 stars should be...”
Reviews.Author: GuideMichelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of May for a short conference in the nearby AXA Auditorium accompanied by my partner who came along to relax and enjoy Barcelona. Location: The design hotel front is situated on a quiet street parallel to the 'diagonal' somewhere in the middle between the city centre and Camp Nou stadium. The hotels rear entrance gives access to a small park enclosed by the hotel, AXA auditorio and L'Illa shopping mall. Good: -Top location for a conference in the AXA Auditorium and shopping in the L'Illa mall. -Overall design of the hotel -The roof top pool, although they should ban smoking on the terrace next to the pool. -The adjacent park with small restaurants Not so good: -Poor in room amenities. E.g. only shampoo and soap in the bathroom, no cotton swaps, bathing cap etc. No iron in the cupboard etc. Most 4 star hotels pack a lot more to make your stay more convenient. The minimalist design was continued in the amenities. -Maintenance status of the room was poor. Several small cracks, dents and flaws throughout the design furniture and carpeting etc. Things that could easily have been fixed. -All service one would expect at a 4 star place is at a hefty additional bonus, e.g. a few hours of in room internet comes at a price one would pay for a month of international 3G/UMTS access. -The room window cannot be opened without help of hotels staff. Having it closed gives the room almost a bunker like experience. Overall the bang for the buck was just way too low. At €170 a night one would expect a fully catered luxury stay but it was only just above mediocre. A lot of 3 star places do better. They rely heavily on the design of the hotel and seem to have forgotten it should be about the guests and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for conferences”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Sep 2008 so my review is based on a very short stay. Hotel was easy to get to from the airport and staff were pretty friendly given I arrived on a public holiday. It was also an easy place to access the city as I then moved on to another hotel. My company had organised a meeting at the hotel for 100+ staff and the rooms were all ready on time and appropriate. Okay food given the numbers dictated buffet style for each meal. Good, but not great, stay but certainly have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2BeachGoers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days in July 2008. I dont generally write reviews, but I thought it was necessary for this hotel due to the last comments. Style: This is a nice hotel. It is decorated in a very minimalist modern style, lots of glass and concrete. It is very cool if you like that style. If you are looking for a quaint old-world hotel, this is not for you. Rooms: We had a room with two twin beds pushed together to make a king bed, a nice plasma tv, and an air conditioner and door lock that worked. The A/C does take a little while to cool off the room, but give it an hour and it'll be very cold. Our bathroom had a nice soaking tub and a separate shower, very modern - with charcoal gray tile and red glass. They give you bathrobes and slippers plus all the usual shower amenities and a hair dryer. Amenities: Every guest is allowed a 15 minute internet session, with a code they give you at the front desk. There is a nice hotel bar with a lounge and tv's. They also have a great Eurpoean style breakfast with cheeses, meats, breads, and even eggs and sausage. They give you bottles of water and chocolates for the turn down service. There is no concierge/tour desk because it caters more to business travelers, although the front desk is helpful if you are looking for a nearby restaurant or directions. Location: It is a bit far from the subway, maybe 8 blocks or so, it is however located close to the tram and the avenida diagonal. It is a very safe location, next to the police station. We walked back from the subway around midnight on a weeknight and saw other people walking too. I dont know if i'd stay there again due to the location, but if i was visiting a museum closeby or doing business there, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing architecture”
Reviews.Author: AirVagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night. First room they gave me had an inoperative air conditioner, which the management said was operable "You just need to give it time to work." Nope, it was broken. I finally had to insist strongly that they give me a new room. Even the new room had a broken electronic lock that they had to send maintenance up to reprogram. Architecture is ultra modern, stark and sterile in the extreme, steel, glass, no color, pictures, flowers . . . . inhuman really. Actually depressing. Like it was designed by a robot. This hotel's architecture is the antithesis of the Spanish character of enjoying life, color, style, and beauty The hotel is a long walk to the subway and far from the old city. Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel due to the depressing architecture and location.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Constanza
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Deu i Mata 69-99, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
